solution_line_template: If your dog is {dog_age_total} years old then in his first year of life he lived {dog_age_year1}*{human_years_first_year_rate} = {human_years_year1} human years
In his second year of life, he lived {dog_age_year2}*{human_years_second_year_rate} = <<{dog_age_year2}*{human_years_second_year_rate}={human_years_year2}>>{human_years_year2} human years

We need to calculate his remaining years or {dog_age_total}-{years_accounted_for} = <<{dog_age_total}-{years_accounted_for}={remaining_dog_years}>>{remaining_dog_years} years of dog life into human years

If {dog_year_unit} year of dog life after the {years_accounted_for} years equates to {human_years_subsequent_rate} human years, then {remaining_dog_years} years of dog life equals {remaining_dog_years}*{human_years_subsequent_rate} = <<{remaining_dog_years}*{human_years_subsequent_rate}={human_years_remaining}>>{human_years_remaining} human years

In total, your dog has lived {human_years_year1} + {human_years_year2} + {human_years_remaining} = <<{human_years_year1}+{human_years_year2}+{human_years_remaining}={total_human_years}>>{total_human_years} human years
